sect2.title: Configuring Your Time Zone
sect2.para: You will first be prompted to configure your time zone. Macintosh hardware clocks are normally set to local time. If you want to dual-boot, select local instead of GMT. After selecting local vs. GMT hardware clock setting, you will select a region and then a city within that region which is in the same time zone you are. When making selections in these lists, you can type a single letter to take you to the section of the list beginning with that letter.
